title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks on Tuesday, 19 January 2016. - BBC News
summary: milton keynes rape investigation discontinued after `` extensive inquiries '' .
the director of a & e at bedford hospital has urged people to think twice before turning up for treatment .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we hope you 've enjoyed our coverage today .
the team will be back tomorrow to do it all again from 08:00 .
do email , tweet or facebook us if you 'd like to share a or story .

documents.title: ambulance service puts out plea following inappropriate calls
text: the east of england ambulance service has made a plea for `` a little more respect '' after releasing details of instances where the service has been misused or people have been abusive .
one man in luton dialled 999 to say he felt sick after drinking a fizzy drink too quickly .
we 'd urge them to think twice about calling the emergency ambulance service if it 's not a life-threatening or serious medical emergency . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : dry and much colder overnight
text: staying dry with a widespread frost developing this evening with overnight temperatures much colder than of late at -2c ( 28f ) .
tomorrow 's looking dry and generally sunny after a very frosty start with temperatures reaching 4c ( 39f ) .
weather has more local forecasts .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: woman fined for hoax police call-out
text: a woman has been fined £ 90 for wasting police time after falsely claiming she was being held hostage in her home .
the 40-year-old from arlesey told a family member she was being held against her will on january 12 .
this was reported to police , who sent armed response officers round to discover it was not true .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wycombe and mk dons set for fa cup replay action
text: there are fa cup third round replays tonight for wycombe wanderers and milton keynes dons , with lucrative fourth round ties awaiting the winners .
wycombe travel to aston villa with the winners due to host manchester city , while mk dons face northampton town with a clash against chelsea on offer .
full commentary will be available on three counties sport from 19:00 .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: headlines : bedfordshire woman fined for wasting police time over false hostage claim ambulance service plea over abusive calls
text: the main news stories tonight :
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hertfordshire schools to run cookery lessons for parents
text: parents and children at 40 primary schools in hertfordshire are being given joint cookery lessons in a bid to encourage healthy eating .
the classes are being piloted by the county council and aim to help families better `` understand how to eat a balanced and nutritious diet on a budget '' .
according to the local authority , one in five 4-5 year olds is overweight or obese as well as almost one third of 10-11 year olds , in hertfordshire .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: man jailed for money laundering
text: a man caught with £ 64,000 cash in a hired porsche at south mimms has been jailed for 10 months .
jason gilbert , 49 , from london , and his passenger were stopped last july by police who were handed a carrier bag with the cash after asking gilbert if he had anything to declare .
both men denied possession of criminal property but gilbert was convicted of money laundering following a week-long trial at st albans crown court .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: 999 : 'i drunk my fizzy drink too quick '
text: people are being urged to treat the 999 system with respect after a man from luton called the emergency number to say he felt sick after drinking his fizzy drink too quickly .
the east of england ambulance service ( eeast ) has also released a call in which a man swore 15 times in four minutes ( the swearing is bleeped out of the clip below ) .
eeast says he was calling with a genuine medical emergency but continued to use extremely offensive language while the operator tried to establish where to send the ambulance .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: afternoon headlines : man jailed after cash found in car ambulance service releases abusive 999 call
text: afternoon headlines : man jailed after cash found in car ambulance service releases abusive 999 call
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: boyfriend attacked man with a baseball bat after girlfriend called 'fat '
text: a man who used a baseball bat to attack a man who told his girlfriend she had got fat has been given a three-month jail sentence , suspended for 18 months .

ben breckon , 19 , from king 's langley , hertfordshire , became angry when he heard colin bignell had insulted his partner , who worked as a barmaid at the cart and horses near sarratt , st alban 's crown court heard .
breckon pleaded guilty to causing actual bodily harm , possessing an offensive weapon and criminal damage .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: hertfordshire morning sky
text: this of a stunning sky was taken over hemel hempstead by john o'reilly this morning .
if you have any images please send them to us at bhblive @ bbc.co.uk

documents.title: watford recommends council tax freeze
text: watford borough council 's cabinet is proposing freezing its share of the council tax bill for the next financial year .
the full council will consider the recommendation on 27 january .

it comes as hertfordshire residents are expected to pay more in council tax next year , with hertfordshire county council 's part of the bill expected to rise by 3.99 % , while the police commissioner 's precept is expected to be cut slightly .

documents.title: whipsnade zoo features on bbc dinosaur documentary
text: elephants and giraffes from whipsnade zoo in bedfordshire feature on attenborough and the giant dinosaur on bbc1 this sunday at 18:30 .
the programme tells the story of the fossil discovery and reconstruction in argentina of the largest known dinosaur , a new species of titanosaur , which was 37 metres long ( 121 feet ) .
sir david visited whipsnade to discover more about the eating habits of very large animals and how their bodies are adapted for walking .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: car crashes into house in bucks
text: police in buckinghamshire are searching for the driver of a car which collided with a house in stoke poges yesterday morning , causing major damage to the property .
it happened in rogers lane , but the black volkswagen involved did n't stop .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: the big cosgrove from the skies
text: our main today shows an aerial view of cosgrove in milton keynes .
many thanks to shannon hartley , from central beds college , for the image .

documents.title: lunchtime weather : mainly dry , but feeling very cold
text: many places will stay dry and sunny through the rest of the day with just a few patches of cloud .
however , it will still feel very cold , despite the light winds .
maximum temperature : 3c ( 37f ) .

documents.title: wycombe wanderers players need to 'get off to a quick start '
text: wycombe wanderers boss gareth ainsworth wants to unsettle aston villa 's fans tonight in their fa cup third round replay .
he will tell his players to get off to a quick start against the premier league bottom club to try to turn the villa park home faithful .
in the first tie at adams park , villa were booed off by their away fans .

as a football manager i want to take every advantage over every situation and if we can find a chink of light , and that lets us in , all the disruption at aston villa will help us come out on top . ''
author: Geoff Doyle
BBC Three Counties Radio sport

documents.title: charges dropped over aylesbury scuba diver death
text: a scuba diver facing extradition to malta has spoken of his elation after charges against him over the deaths of his girlfriend and friend were dropped .
larissa hooley , 48 , from aylesbury , and nigel haines , 59 , of hove ( died during the incident off the island of gozo .
stephen martin , 56 , from rustington , west sussex , was due to face trial on charges of involuntary homicide after the pair died during a dive in 2012 .

documents.title: john lewis launch recruitment drive in milton keynes
text: john lewis has launched a recruitment drive in milton keynes for 60 jobs at its third national distribution centre to open at magna park .

responsibilities will include receiving and storing products , individual branch orders , loading goods onto trailers using mechanical handling equipment such as forklift trucks and ensuring the right products go to the right shops .
author: One MK

documents.title: luton gp surgeries : 'no decision has been made '
text: luton health bosses insist patients will be consulted over the future of four gp surgeries under threat of closure .
moakes medical centre , whipperley medical centre , chapel street walk-in centre and sundon park health centre ( provide nhs services through contracts which are coming to an end .

no decision has been made about the future of any of these practices , and none will be made without the registered patients of each practice [ being ] involved in finding the best possible solution . ''

documents.title: brrrrrr ! temperatures down to well below freezing last night
text: how cold was it last night ?
down to -5.8c ( 22f ) in woburn in bedfordshire .
temperatures should only drop to freezing point tonight .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: morning headlines : consultation over luton gp surgeries mk rape investigation discontinued
text: morning headlines : consultation over luton gp surgeries mk rape investigation discontinued
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: nuisance motorbikes : beds police to step up response
text: bedfordshire police are promising to step up their response to nuisance motorcyclists after criticism from the public in the south of the county .
a public meeting at a luton school last night , chaired by bbc three counties , was told a new email address is being set up to improve the police response .
at the meeting , supt sharn basra promised more money for off-road bikes for officers .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: bedford hospital a & e 'busy until the spring '
text: bedford hospital says it expects its accident and emergency department to be busy until the spring .
doctors are repeating their request for people who are n't seriously ill to seek treatment from other branches of the nhs , such as pharmacies and walk-in centres .

these are the most difficult months of the year and , probably between now up to even the middle of march , we will be feeling a lot of pressure within our hospital to see and cope with the number of patients who require acute hospital care . ''

documents.title: future of four luton gp surgeries uncertain
text: the future of four gp surgeries in luton is uncertain , as their contracts are coming to an end .
nhs england says no firm decision has been taken on the futures of the moakes medical centre , whipperley medical centre ( sundon park health centre and the chapel street walk-in centre .
patients will be consulted .

documents.title: travel news : broken down trains cause delays
text: travel news : broken down trains cause delays
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: milton keynes rape investigation discontinued
text: an investigation into a rape allegation has been discontinued following `` extensive inquiries '' , police said .
a woman reported she had been attacked by a man on thursday afternoon after he forced his way into a residential property in milton keynes .
det insp ian jarvis , of thames valley police , said : `` this investigation has now concluded and police are no longer investigating an allegation of rape . ''

documents.title: weather : frosty start with some sunshine
text: many places will have a dry and sunny day , with just a few patches of cloud .
however , it will still feel very cold , despite the light winds .
maximum temperature : 3c ( 37f ) .

BBC Look East weather
